bitfield.description: Peripheral Identification CCD/CMOS controller
Class Identification VPFE module
Peripheral Revision Number Initial Revision
External pattern generator enable Enabling this bit force the external pins to send out the pattern generator output (for testing purposes)
Pattern generator enable Enabling this bit will disregard the CCDC input data and generate standard color bars for testing
CCDC Busy bit
CCDC Enable
Video port output into the SDRAM port Controls whether or not video port data is forwarded to the output formatter, which in turn writes to SDRAM *This bit is latched by VD
Data Write Enable Controls whether or not CCD raw data is written to SDRAM. *This bit is latched by VD
VD/HD Enable If VD/HD are defined as output, activates internal timing generator. If VD/HD are defined as inputs, activates internal timing generator to synchronize with VD/HD
Field Status Indicates the status of the current field when in interlaced mode
3-tap Low-Pass (anti-aliasing) Filter *This bit is latched by VD
Setting of data input mode
Pack to 8-bits/pixel (into SDRAM)
CCD Data Width valid only when INPMOD is set to '0'
Sensor Field Mode
CCD Data Polarity
External WEN Selection When set to 1 and when VDHDEN is set to 1, input CCD data is loaded into SDRAM

bitenum.description: do not use external WEN (Write Enable)

bitfield.description: Field Indicator Polarity
HD Sync Polarity
VD Sync Polarity
Field ID Direction
VD/HD Sync Direction
Width of HD sync pulse if output HDW+1 pixel clocks HDWIDTH is not used when HD is input, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD
Width of VD sync pulse if output VDW+1 lines VDWIDTH is not used when VD is input, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD

register.description: Number of pixels in a horizontal line and number of lines in a frame

bitfield.description: Pixels per line - number of pixel clock periods in one line HD period = PPLN+1 pixel clocks PPLN is not used when HD and VD are inputs, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD

Half lines per field or frame - sets number of half lines per frame or field VD period = (HLPFR+1)/2 lines LPFR is not used when HD and are inputs, i.e when VDHDOUT in SYN_MODE register is cleared to '0' *This bit field is latched by VD
Start pixel, horizontal Sets pixel clock position at which data output to SDRAM begins, measured from the start of HD *This bit field is latched by VD

Number of pixels, horizontal Sets number of horizontal pixels that will be output to SDRAM = (NPH + 1) 'AND' 0xFFF0, i.e. the number of horizontal output pixels is truncated to multiples of 16. *This bit field is latched by VD

register.description: Vertical line - settings for the starting pixel

bitfield.description: Start Line, Vertical (Field 0) Sets line at which data output to SDRAM will begin, measured from the start of VD *This bit field is latched by VD
Start Line, Vertical (Field 1) Sets line at which data output to SDRAM will begin, measured from the start of VD *This bit field is latched by VD
Number of lines, vertical Sets number of vertical lines that will be output to SDRAM. The number of lines output to SDRAM = (NLV + 1). *This bit field is latched by VD

register.description: Culling information in horizontal and vertical directions

bitfield.description: Horizontal Culling Pattern for Even Line, 8-bit mask: 0: cull, 1:retain LSB is first pixel, MSB is 8th pixel, then pattern repeats *This bit field is latched by VD
Horizontal Culling Pattern for Odd Line, 8-bit mask: 0: cull, 1:retain LSB is first pixel, MSB is 8th pixel, then pattern repeats *This bit field is latched by VD
Vertical Culling Pattern, 8-bit mask: 0: cull, 1:retain LSB is first line, MSB is 8th line, then pattern repeats. *This bit field is latched by VD

Address offset for each line. Sets offset for each output line in SDRAM Either 16 or 32 pixels depending on setting of PACK8 *This bit field is latched by VD The 5 LSB are ignored; the offset will be on a 32-byte boundary
Field identification signal inverse * This field is latched by VD
Line offset value of field ID = 1 * This field is latched by VD
Line offset values of even line and even field ID = 0 * This field is latched by VD
Line offset values of odd line and even field ID = 0 * This field is latched by VD
Line offset values of even line and odd field ID = 1 * This field is latched by VD
Line offset values of odd line and odd field ID = 1 * This field is latched by VD

32-bit SDRAM starting address for CCDC output *This bit field is latched by VD Note that the address should be aligned on a 32-byte boundary. Therefore, the 5 LSB's are ignored. Furthermore, reading this register will always show the 5 LSB's as 0.
Clamp Enable: Enables clamping of CCD data based on the calculated average of Optical Black Samples. *This bit is latched by VD
Optical Black Sample Length 5-7: Reserved Number of Optical Black Sample pixels per line to include in the average calculation
Optical Black Sample Lines 5-7: Reserved Number of Optical Black Sample lines to include in the average calculation
Start Pixel of Optical Black Samples Start pixel position of Optical Black Samples, specified from the start of HD in pixel clocks
Gain to apply to the optical black average Multiply the optical black average with the specified gain (range from 0 to ~2 - U5Q4)
DC level to subtract from CCD data The DC value set here is subtracted from the CCD data when OBS clamping is disabled - CLAMP:CLAMPEN
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 3rd Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 2nd Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 1st Line, Pixel counter = 0
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 3
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 2
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 1
Color Pattern for 0th Line, Pixel counter = 0
Black level compensation for R/Ye pixels (-128:+127) 2's complement, MSB is sign bit
Black level compensation for Gr/Cy pixels (-128:+127) 2's complement, MSB is sign bit
Black level compensation for Gb/G pixels (-128:+127) 2's complement, MSB is sign bit
Black level compensation for B/Mg pixels (-128:+127) 2's complement, MSB is sign bit

Fault pixel correction error Write 1 to clear the error or end of frame will clear it automatically for next frame This bit is set when the CCDC is unable to fetch the required fault pixel table entry in time for it to correct it. For example, the current pixel being processed has coordinates of 256/512 (256th line and 512th pixel in that line) and it needs to be corrected. If the entry in the fault pixel table that needs to be used has coordinates 256/256, then the current pixel cannot be corrected since the correct entry is not loaded in time. Note that there is no error recovery mechanism in the CCDC; if this bit is set at anytime in a frame, there will no more fault pixels corrected in that frame. Firmware is responsible for making sure that there is enough bandwidth in the system to allow for loading of the fault pixel table. Alternately, decreasing the frequency of the fault pixels to be corrected will enhance chances of this bit not being set.

Fault pixel correction enable Upon setting this bit and as long as it remains enabled the fault pixel logic will continue to request data and just start over once the last data has been received. As soon as the register is set the data will be fetched
Number of fault pixels to be corrected in the frame *This field is latched by VD

Starting SDRAM/DDRAM address of the fault pixel correction entries Note that the address should be aligned to a 64-byte boundary, therefore, the 6 LSB's are ignored Each of the 32-bit fault memory entry contains a 13-bit vertical position, a 14-bit horizontal position, and a 5-bit operation field The following operations are decoded by the 5-bit operation field (4:0) Note that x denotes the horizontal coordinate 0: replace pixel at x with the average of x-1 and x+1 1: replace pixel at x with the x-1 2: replace pixel at x with the x+1 3: replace pixel at x with the average of x-2 and x+2 4: replace pixel at x with the x-2 5: replace pixel at x with the x+2 6: replace pixel at x with the average of x-3 and x+3 7: replace pixel at x with the x-3 8: replace pixel at x with the x+3 9: replace pixel at x with the average of x-4 and x+4 10: replace pixel at x with the x-4 11: replace pixel at x with the x+4 12: replace pixel at x with the average of x-5 and x+5 13: replace pixel at x with the x-5 14: replace pixel at x with the x+5 15: replace pixel at x with the average of x-6 and x+6 16: replace pixel at x with the x-6 17: replace pixel at x with the x+6 18-31: RESERVED
VD0 Interrupt Timing Specify VDINT0 in units of horiziontal lines from the start of VD pulse
VD1 Interrupt Timing Specify VDINT1 in units of horizontal lines from the start of VD pulse
Apply Gamma (A-LAW) to CCDC data saved to SDRAM
Gamma Width Input (A-LAW table)
FVH Error Correction Enable
REC656 Interface Enable
Enable latching function registers on internal VSYNC
MSB of Chroma signal output inverted
MSB of Chroma input signal stored to SDRAM inverted
Byte Swap Data stored to SDRAM
Location of Y signal when YCbCr 8bit data is input
Specifies CCD valid area

bitenum.description: Internal valid signal AND WEN signal is ANDed logically
Internal valid signal AND WEN signal is Ored logically

bitfield.description: Setting of FID detection function

bitenum.description: FID signal is latched at the VSYNC timing
FID signal is latched at edge of VD
FID signal is latched based on phase of VD and HD

bitfield.description: Data width in CCIR656 input mode Takes precedence over the SYN_MODE fields INPMOD and DATSIZ if 656 mode is enabled
Y input (YIN[7:0]) and C input (CIN[7:0]) are swapped

bitenum.description: YIN[7:0] = Y signal / CIN[7:0] = C signal
YIN[7:0] = C signal / CIN[7:0] = Y signal

bitfield.description: Configure Y output and C output
Y output (YOUT[7:0]) and C output (COUT[7:0]) are swapped

bitenum.description: YOUT[7:0] = Y signal / COUT[7:0] = C signal
YOUT[7:0] = C signal / COUT[7:0] = Y signal

register.description: Data reformatter/video input interface horizontal information

bitfield.description: Video Port Data Ready Frequency
Video Port Enable
Video Port Input Select (10-bit input)
Number of program entries in even line minus 1 If the desired number of program entries is 8, then this register field should be set to 7
Number of program entries in odd line minus 1 If the desired number of program entries is 8, then this register field should be set to 7
Number of output lines from 1 input line
Line Alternating mode In Line Alternating Mode, even and odd lines are swapped.. 0th line output as 1st line and 1st line output as 0th line, and so on
CCD Formatter enable *This bit is latched by VD

register.description: Data reformatter/video input interface vertical information

bitfield.description: Start pixel horizontal from start of HD
Number of pixels in horizontal direction

register.description: Data reformatter line size and length

bitfield.description: Start line from start of VD
Number of lines in vertical direction
The output line the address belongs to

Initial address value If FMTCFG.LNUM = 0 (1-line), the maximum value of the address cannot exceed 4x1376 - 1 including the updates on it during the processing If FMTCFG.LNUM = 1 (2-line), the maximum value of the address cannot exceed 2x1376 -1 including the updates on it during the processing If FMTCFG.LNUM = 2 (3-line), the maximum value of the address cannot exceed 1376 - 1 including the updates on it during the processing If FMTCFG.LNUM = 3 (4-line), the maximum value of the address cannot exceed 1376 - 1 including the updates on it during the processing The address should always be a positive number during the updates
The output line the address belongs to

Number of vertical lines to clock out the video port The video port output VSYNC is generated right from the 1st video port input VSYNC itself

Number of horizontal pixels to clock out the video port Maximum offset allowed is 1376 if original input is broken down to 4 lines Maximum offset allowed is 1376 if original input is broken down to 3 lines Maximum offset allowed is 2*1376 if original input is broken down to 2 lines Maximum offset allowed is 4*1376 if original input is broken down to 1 line

Horizontal start pixel in each output line Maximum offset allowed is 15, the video port output HSYNC is generated from this position on for each line. In order to be able to select an offset higher than 15, the input settings to the data reformatter should be configured appropriately. The purpose of this parameter is to allow for sensors that can read out a parallelogram image rather than a rectangular image
